incidents.name: Webhooks system partial outage

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
After a partial overload condition in the Webhooks system operation is returning back to normal. We are currently monitoring the situation.
We have detected an issue with our Webhooks system that we are currently investigating. Customer may experience delays in Webhooks triggers.

incidents.name: Elevated GraphQL error rates.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved. We see all systems fully operational again.

The elevated errors were caused by a faulty GraphQL node and affected a small single digit percentage of requests only. We resolved the problem and are monitoring the situation to ensure the error doesn't reappear.
We're currently investigating a single digit percentage increase above normal GraphQL error rates.

incidents.name: Increased error rates on Contentful Delivery and Management APIs

incident_updates.body: Between 15:48 and 16:01 (UTC) today Customers experienced a large spike in errors across our Management and Delivery APIs. All systems have recovered and we not expect any further issues.
Error rates have dropped back to normal levels. We will continue to monitor the situation.
We have identified the issue and error rates have come down but we are still working on a complete fix for the problem.
We are investigating an issue affecting our Delivery and Management APIs.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved, and all systems have fully recovered.
We rolled out a fix for the affected spaces and are monitoring the situation.
We narrowed the problem down to the affected database and are applying corrective measures to resolve the problem.
Our monitoring systems have detected increased response times and errors for a minority of requests. We are currently investigating the issue.

incidents.name: Unexpected "Premium expired" message on entries

incident_updates.body: This message has been removed.

Some users of the Conditional Fields by Prototyp app may notice the message "Premium expired! Conditions are disabled. Renew your subscription or remove all premium rules" on fields. This message is related to your subscription to the Conditional Fields service and not your subscription to Contentful. If you see this banner, there is no issue with your Contentful account.

incidents.name: Bynder - Issues Adding Assets for Customers on Bynder's Global infrastructure

incident_updates.body: The issue with the Contentful Bynder integration is now resolved.

We are monitoring an issue with adding assets in the Contentful Bynder integration for Bynder customers on their Global infrastructure. We will provide an update when this issue is resolved. You can monitor Bynder status at https://status.bynder.com/incidents/xtj8494dfkrt

incidents.name: Issues with Assets and Image retrieval in Europe

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A mitigation has been put in place and we are monitoring the results.
Some customers are experiencing issues retrieving assets and images from Europe. We have identified the root cause and are working on rolling out a mitigation

components.name: Image API

incidents.name: Phrase Strings - Issues with translation order charges

incident_updates.body: The Contentful Marketplace app provider Phrase Strings has indicated that the issue with duplicate charges will remain open and recommends that customers not retry confirming orders once submitted. You can continue to view their status at https://status.phrase.com/.

The Contentful Marketplace app provider Phrase Strings is reporting issues with transactions in its US data center and recommends that US customers avoid requesting translation orders at this time. You can view their status at https://status.phrase.com/.

incidents.name: Marketplace Apps Not Installable

incident_updates.body: We rolled out a fix and verified that installing apps works again. The issue affected only installations done via our web app. Installation requests made directly to the API weren't affected.
We have identified the issue with app installations and are working on fix.
We are currently investigating an issue preventing the installation of Contentful Marketplace apps. Existing app installations are not impacted.

incidents.name: Increased Latency and errors on Content Management API

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Latency and error rates are back to normal for all customers on the Content Management API. We are continuing to monitor the situation.
We have identified the cause of the issue and have deployed a mitigation so customers will see latency levels return to normal.
We are still looking into the caused of the increased latency and errors.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
Some customers are experiencing issues with increased latency and error rates on the Content Management API. We are investigating the issue.

incidents.name: Intermittent network failures on Login page

incidents.name: Errors on GraphQL Content API for some users

incident_updates.body: Due to a faulty deployment, some requests to our GraphQL API were failing with 5xx errors in the timeframe between 16:00 and 16:15 CET. The change has been reverted, the system is operational again.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

incidents.name: Increase errors across Content Management API

incidents.name: Increased errors on Content Delivery APIs (CDA and GraphQL)

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Our upstream CDN provider have resolved an issue with a cache node in the Dublin POP which has mitigated impact from this issue. We are continuing to work with them and will monitor the situation.
We are working with our upstream Content Delivery Network (CDN) provider to troubleshoot the issue. The issue currently is isolated to connections through the Dublin POP.
Some customers are experiencing increased errors on the Content Delivery API and GraphQL API. We are currently investigating the issue.

incidents.name: Increased errors/delays with Webhooks, App Actions and App Events

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are seeing recovery across all impacted services. We will continue to monitor this issue.
We are seeing some recovery of the Webhooks, App actions and App Events service.

The Webhooks service is still experiencing an outage, related to the 3rd party provider issue. The following Contentful Marketplace apps are also effected by this event: GA4, Slack, JIRA, Shopify, Netlify, Smartling, Typeform, AI Image Tagging
Some customers are experiencing errors and delays to Webhooks, App Actions and App Events, due to an upstream issue with a 3rd party provider.

incident_updates.body: Some customers on single shared database experienced errors and increased latency on the Content Management API (CMA) today between 8:30 and 14:00 CET. The API is back operating as normal and we don't expect any further impact.

incidents.name: Issues with some Contentful Apps and UI Extensions not working

A bug was introduced which affected Apps and UI extensions for the following locations: field, editor, sidebar. We deployed a fix which has resolved the issue but we will continue to monitor.
We have identified the root cause of the issue affecting Field Apps and implemented a fix.
We are currently investigating an issue with some Contentful Apps not working

incidents.name: Issues with image and asset uploads in the Contentful WebApp

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The root cause of the issue has been identified and solutions are being validated.
This issue with file uploads on the WebApp continues to affect some customers. The resolution is still being worked on.

Some customers are experiencing failures or increased errors when trying to upload files to Contentful through the WebApp. This is related to an issue with a 3rd party provider. We are working with them to resolve the issue.

incidents.name: Connection issues on Contentful APIs

incident_updates.body: A CDN issue was identified as the source of the issue, which was reported as fixed within 10 minutes of the start of the event. If you are still experiencing issues connecting to our APIs or logging into Contentful please reach out to Customer Support.
Our provider has applied a fix and we are monitoring the situation.
Traffic levels are almost back to normal but we are still seeing failures in our monitoring, we continue to investigate.
Between 22:59 and 23:10 UTC our monitoring systems detected connection failures to our main APIs. We are investigating a possible issue with our CDN layer.

incidents.name: Issues with Content Management API (CMA)

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The fix has now been fully implemented and the Content Management API is now operating normally. We will continue to monitor.
We have rolled out a fix but some customers still may be receiving 403 (Access forbidden) responses on the CMA. We are working on resolving these cases.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

incidents.name: Issues with scheduled Publish/Un-publish actions

incident_updates.body: A bug was introduced in how we query the list of scheduled actions which we show on the Contentful WebApp. We incorrectly returned old failed and successful actions (and not just scheduled ones). We implemented a fix and the issue is now resolved - there was no impact to customers scheduled actions/events.
We identified the source of the issue, and pushed a change to fix the problem with scheduled actions. We are continuing to monitor to ensure no more customers are experiencing issues.
Some customers are seeing unknown scheduled publish/un-publish actions appearing on all entries. We are currently investigating the issue.

incidents.name: CMA outage for some customers

incident_updates.body:
This incident has been resolved. 

A cleanup task caused some routes to go missing and caused a CMA outage to some of our customers. Reinstating the routes, restored service availability.
We've implemented a fix and are monitoring the results.
We've identified the issue and are working on a fix.
We are investigating a partial outage with the CMA for some of our customers. We are actively looking into this and will post updates as we uncover the issue.
